channel.title: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2012 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: For Cash, Murderer Leads Police To Victims' Remains
item.description: Authorities in California are excavating the gruesome remains of murder victims who were buried many years ago by a pair of convicted murderers dubbed the "Speed Freak Killers." The case raises some thorny ethical and legal issues: Should convicted criminals be able to benefit from their wrongdoing?
item.content:encoded:
Authorities in California are excavating the gruesome remains of murder victims who were buried many years ago by a pair of convicted murderers dubbed the "Speed Freak Killers." The case raises some thorny ethical and legal issues: Should convicted criminals be able to benefit from their wrongdoing?

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: With Payroll Tax Cut Done, Is It Do-Nothing Congress Time? It Depends
item.description: Whether a Congress can be defined as do-something or do-nothing is really in the eye of the beholder. If you judge Congress by its ability to pass landmark legislation or bills that address the real needs of the U.S. population, then you likely won't be giving Congress over the next year high marks for accomplishing much.
item.content:encoded:
Whether a Congress can be defined as do-something or do-nothing is really in the eye of the beholder. If you judge Congress by its ability to pass landmark legislation or bills that address the real needs of the U.S. population, then you likely won't be giving Congress over the next year high marks for accomplishing much.

item.title: A Passion To Bear Witness: Why War Correspondents Take The Risk
item.description: NPR's Deborah Amos, who covers the Middle East, ponders the question, "Is a story worth dying for?"
item.content:encoded:
NPR's Deborah Amos, who covers the Middle East, ponders the question, "Is a story worth dying for?"

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: WHO Affirms Use Of Birth Control Injections After Weighing HIV Risks
item.description: The WHO upheld its guidelines on the safety of hormone injections for contraception yesterday, despite some data that users are at increased risk of HIV transmission. An expert panel says the evidence isn't solid yet, and at-risk couples should use a second method, like condoms, for HIV prevention.
item.content:encoded:
The WHO upheld its guidelines on the safety of hormone injections for contraception yesterday, despite some data that users are at increased risk of HIV transmission. An expert panel says the evidence isn't solid yet, and at-risk couples should use a second method, like condoms, for HIV prevention.

item.title: Reports: In Sting, Feds Arrest Man Plotting Suicide Bombing In Washington
item.description: The man was under FBI surveillance and was planning to bomb the U.S. Capitol in a suicide attack.
item.content:encoded:
The man was under FBI surveillance and was planning to bomb the U.S. Capitol in a suicide attack.

item.title: Murdoch Promises Sunday Edition At Besieged Sun Tabloid
item.description: Murdoch tells staff at The Sun, where ten current and former journalists have been arrested in recent weeks, that the paper will roll out a Sunday edition "soon."
item.content:encoded:
Murdoch tells staff at The Sun, where ten current and former journalists have been arrested in recent weeks, that the paper will roll out a Sunday edition "soon."

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: 'Sugar Daddies' And Debates Changing All The Rules
item.description: Before setting foot in Michigan, Rick Santorum was leading in GOP polls there. It's the clearest illustration yet that the traditional rules that determine primary winners have been upended by factors that are new this time around, such as superPACs and the proliferation of candidate debates.
item.content:encoded:
Before setting foot in Michigan, Rick Santorum was leading in GOP polls there. It's the clearest illustration yet that the traditional rules that determine primary winners have been upended by factors that are new this time around, such as superPACs and the proliferation of candidate debates.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Is That A Plastic Baby Jesus In My Cake?
item.description: It isn't Mardi Gras without a king cake, a sugary confection topped with lurid icing that just screams indulgence. But in recent years the traditional porcelain baby has been elbowed out by a plastic model that you have to hide yourself.
item.content:encoded:
It isn't Mardi Gras without a king cake, a sugary confection topped with lurid icing that just screams indulgence. But in recent years the traditional porcelain baby has been elbowed out by a plastic model that you have to hide yourself.

item.title: #Feb17: A First Visit To Revolution Central: The Benghazi Courthouse
item.description: Celebrations abound in Benghazi, but the courthouse is special. It was the scene of some of the first protests in Libya.
item.content:encoded:
Celebrations abound in Benghazi, but the courthouse is special. It was the scene of some of the first protests in Libya.

item.title: Proview Threatens Apple With $2 Billion Suit Over iPad Trademark
item.description: Apple released documents that suggest it bought the iPad trademark from the company for $55,000.
item.content:encoded:
Apple released documents that suggest it bought the iPad trademark from the company for $55,000.

item.title: Syrian Troops Step Up Homs Shelling After U.N. Resolution
item.description: Syrian troops step up shelling of Homs after United Nations condemns the violence.
item.content:encoded:
Syrian troops step up shelling of Homs after United Nations condemns the violence.

item.title: Key Economic Indicators Signal Growth
item.description: A gauge of future economic activity rose in January for the fourth straight month, adding to evidence that the economy has strengthened in the new year. The Conference Board said its index of leading economic indicators rose 0.4 percent in January to its highest point since July 2008.
item.content:encoded:
A gauge of future economic activity rose in January for the fourth straight month, adding to evidence that the economy has strengthened in the new year. The Conference Board said its index of leading economic indicators rose 0.4 percent in January to its highest point since July 2008.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Congress Passes Payroll Tax Extension
item.description: The Republican-controlled House voted 293-132, followed quickly by a simple majority vote in the Senate. President Obama is expected to sign the bill.
item.content:encoded:
The Republican-controlled House voted 293-132, followed quickly by a simple majority vote in the Senate. President Obama is expected to sign the bill.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: House Passes Payroll Tax Cut, Jobless Benefit Bill
item.description: The GOP-controlled House has passed a bill renewing a payroll tax cut for 160 million workers and jobless benefits for millions more, backing the main items on President Barak Obama's jobs agenda in a rare burst of bipartisanship.
item.content:encoded:
The GOP-controlled House has passed a bill renewing a payroll tax cut for 160 million workers and jobless benefits for millions more, backing the main items on President Barak Obama's jobs agenda in a rare burst of bipartisanship.

item.title: The Libyan Art Of Honking
item.description: Libyans mark one-year anniversary of uprising with a cacophony of celebratory horn honking
item.content:encoded:
Libyans mark one-year anniversary of uprising with a cacophony of celebratory horn honking
